Transcription for 1268591

I am queen of the mountains of my own, Of the mountains where in childhood I would roam.
I have welled with southern skies, Where the summer never lies,
But my heart is in the mountains of my own.
I can see the yellow forest gate of the hill, I can hear the magic music of the wind.
There is nothing to compare with the love that once was there, In that gloomy little house way up the hill.
I can see a little church far down below, Where the mountain reeds wonder, hope and hope,
And when there my soul shall be, It is there my world to sleep, With those beautiful boys, And lovely waterfalls.
Thanks for watching!
